reviewText: The packaging, like in the others, is fantastic, and the picture and sound quality is great.The actual season is one of my favorites with a multitude of great episodes such as:Egg Story: With Helga and Arnold having to babysit an egg for a school project.Deconstructing Arnold: When everyone turns on Arnold for being such a "goody goody" always giving advice, when this turns on them.Polishing Rhonda: Rhonda has to attend a school where she must learn to be polite, only she'll need the help of Big Patty to get through it.Definitely worth buying for the kids of 2000. It has things kids can relate to without being inappropriate. Its a shame they had to take it off the air.
summary: Another Great Season. Definitely Worth Watching.

reviewText: I preordered seasons 4 and 5 of Hey Arnold and received them on schedule.  I've tried them in my Panasonic BD60 bluray player, and they work fine.  The images are sharp and the colors bright.  No problems whatsoever.  I love finally being able to see shows I missed from the last two seasons, and eagerly await the chance to order season three, with my all-time favorite episode, School Play (where Helga must confess her secret love for Arnold to be able to play opposite him as Juliet in the school play!)  I love the wry, subtle humor and the strong characterizations that really make you care about the characters of this series, even the "bully" Helga.  I also own the first two seasons, which I watched on an old Toshiba dvd player with no problems.  The only thing I would wish for is subtitles, for those times when you don't quite catch everything people say--although the voice track of Hey Arnold is much better in general than a lot of shows when it comes to clarity.  I just bought a long-awaited favorite old movie of mine from Amazon called The Flight of Dragons (burn-on-demand) and while the movie itself is a magnificent quest, you have to have your remote ready to adjust the volume between the grand, loud background music and shouting scenes, and other scenes where the characters are speaking very softly.
summary: Excellent cartoon series for adults who are interested in Psychology

reviewerName: Reconnecting To My Childhood "Time Won't Let ...
reviewText: I was so happy to purchase Hey Arnold! seasons one and two from Amazon's Made On Demand Create-a-space. I wasn't sure if they would continue with the releases but am very excited to see that they have released Hey Arnold! seasons four and five (and after I initially wrote this the third season became available!!!). It's great to have two more seasons of this great series being made available on DVD for fans. Season four contains the following nineteen episodes, some consisting of two eleven minute halves and others being a full twenty-two minutes which makes 33 stories in all:67 Back to School/Egg Story68 It Girl/Deconstructing Arnold69 Grudge Match/Pollishing Rhonda70 Weird Cousin/Baby Oskar71 Grandpa's Sister/Synchronized Swimming72 Helga Sleepwalks/Fighting Families73 Friday the 13th/Headless Cabbie74 Veterans day75 Helga on the Couch76 Dino Checks Out77 Monkeyman!/Buses, Bikes and Subways78 Helga's Masquerade/Mr. Green Runs79 Sid the Vampire Slayer/Big Sis80 Bag of Money/Principal Simmons81 New Bully on the Block/Phoebe Breaks a Leg82 Parents Day83 Helga's Locket/Sid and Germs84 Suspended/Ernie in Love85 Summer Love (a.k.a. Beach Story)The show found their niche in these later seasons with episodes focusing more on Helga's unexplained adoration of Arnold and the dissection of her complicated character, as well as episodes that frequently found her character's secret at risk of being revealed. Great episodes this season focusing on those ideas are Helga's Masquerade, Helga's locket and fan favorite Helga on the Couch. Summer Love is also a great twenty two minute long episode with multiple fun stories. Other episodes continue with the entertaining idea of branching out the series focus to not just be on Arnold but on his various classmates and sometimes to great comedic affect, the tenants in his grandparents apartment building.The sense of humor in these 'older' shows can play to a more immature childish sense of humor, guy gets hurt or bodily function, but for the most part what I respect about nineties television is that children were never told when to laugh. The jokes were simply presented to us and the character's played things pretty straight, never hitting us over the head, helping our generation understand irony and the actual art of sarcasm. Something I feel is lost in most children's television nowadays where children are told when to laugh by laugh track or by the characters playing it so over the top, it leaves youth today not understanding the subtlety of good humor.I own the first two seasons of this show as well as seasons of Rugrats and Doug on Amazon DVD-R and they play great on all my DVD players. I tend to be uptight about things being quality and have never been bothered by these sets. The show looks as good as when it originally aired in the nineties. The sets have simple DVD menus, packaging and artwork but it all looks nice enough and gets the job done. My only issue with these sets, me being a purist, is that I'd prefer the option of watching the opening theme before every episode but it only plays before the first on each disc. They do this to preserve the quality of the episodes due to compression issues that could start arising and I'm aware most people skip openings anyway, so it's forgivable. Also, don't expect any sort of special features, just the episodes themselves.While it's upsetting that these older Nickelodeon series aren't being released on proper studio made DVD sets I thank Amazon for at least making it possible for fans like me to own these episodes on DVD in decent quality and proper order. Hopefully good sales on these Amazon Made On Demand sets can still convince Nickelodeon to consider proper season releases of their old series with special features, but until the day Nickelodeon realizes the cash to be made in the remarketing of their nineties shows on DVD I'm more than happy to give my business to Amazon and buy these sets. FIVE STARS for the fourth season on DVD-R. I miss growing up in the nineties, thanks for your time.
summary: Children's Television Was Better In The Nineties
Title: N/A

reviewText: So now we come to Season 4. This season in particular had some of the best episodes, so I will, as usual, list my top five, the ones that make this worth buying:"Deconstructing Arnold" - One of the episodes that is perfect for laughs. Arnold's friends are annoyed at Arnold trying to always give them advice, so he stops, but then they find that they really need Arnold to solve their problems. There are three examples, but my personal favourite is Rhonda trying to get Curly to leave her alone. Although he has a different voice actor in this episode, the part when he kisses Rhonda remains a classic scene."Helga Sleepwalks" - After eating pork rinds, Helga starts sleepwalking to Arnold's house every night and even climbs his fire escape to tell him that she's in love with him, in spite of her own, and later Phoebe's, best efforts to stop her. It's a funny episode, and her daydream at the beginning when she first scatters roses around Arnold's stoop and then talks to him on a balcony is priceless."The Beeper Queen" - When Bob hurts his back, Miriam takes over the Beeper store and discovers how much she loves it, becoming the perfect businesswoman and mom - until work begins to take over her life. I love most of the episodes focusing on Helga's family, and it's great to see Miriam reaching her full potential, especially when she's proving her skills as a good mom. It's also very touching when she decides to return home...even if she still can't remember how old her daughter is."Weird Cousin" - Arnold's cousin Arnie visits and Lila is instantly smitten with him, making Arnold feel hurt. Helga offers to help Arnold by pretending she's his girlfriend to make Lila jealous, however, all this does is make Arnie fall for her. Arnie's weird character is very funny, as are the things Arnold and Helga do to make Lila jealous. Best of all is the payoff, when Arnold comforts Lila over Arnie dumping her and just seeing the look on Helga's face when Arnie says "I love you" to her..."Helga On The Couch" - No surprises there. This episode delves into Helga's past and her characteristics when she has her first session with psychologist Dr Bliss. It shows just how bad her life at home is, why she fell in love with Arnold in the first place, and the last five minutes are very satisfying, especially when she hysterically blurts out how she feels about Arnold and is reassured that she is not crazy, just intense and creative.I would also give "Polishing Rhonda" (Rhonda has trouble at polishing school, "Back To School" (Arnold's Grandpa never finished fourth grade, so he enrolls at PS118) and "Egg Story"(When paired up to take care of an egg for a weekend, Arnold and Helga argue constantly) honourable mentions, since they only just got knocked off the list by "Weird Cousin". Still, no true "Hey Arnold" fan can call themselves devoted until they've seen "Helga On The Couch" and so I strongly recommend this season above the others.

reviewText: Hey Arnold! Season 4 contains four dvd's,If you're a fan of Hey Arnold!, Rocko's modern life,the Rugrats and Doug like I am then show your support and buy these Dvd sets from Amazon ^^Disc-11.Back to school- Arnold convinces Grandpa Phil to go back and graduate grade school2.Egg story- The students are paired together and given eggs to care for3.It girl- A fashion designer picks Helga to be his "It girl" because of her angry attitude4.Deconstructing Arnold- The kids beg Arnold for his advice after they get themselves into deep trouble5.Grudge match- Big Bob and Phil have a golfing match to settle who pays for car repairs after their accident6.Polishing Rhonda- Rhonda is in danger of failing polishing school so she begs Patty for help7.Weird cousin- Arnolds very ugly and dumb cousin Arnie comes to visit and Lila falls in love with him8.Baby Oskar- Oskar covinces Arnold to help him take care of a baby while his wife is at work9.Grandpa's sister- Phil's sister comes to the boarding house10.Synchronized swimming- Coach Wittenberg gets the boys to join his synchronized swimming teamDisc-21.Helga sleepwalks- Helga starts sleep walking to Arnolds so she can confess her love to him after eating pork rinds2.Fighting families- Arnold, Phil, Ernie, Mr. Hyunh and Gertrude compete in a game show with another family.3.Headless cabbie- During a sleep over Arnold tells everyone a story about the Headless Cabbie4.Friday the 13th- Wolfgang and Edmond trick Arnold and Gerald into believing that they're cursed5.Veterans day- Grandpa Phil recalls his adventures as a soldier in the Second World War6.Helga on the couch- Helga opens up and tells a psychologist her true feelings about Arnold7.Dino checks out- Dino Spomoni hides out in Arnolds boarding house while everyone believes he's deadDisc-31.Monkeyman- Once Monkeyman gets a taste of normal life with the help of Arnold, he's much too busy to help people in need anymore2.Buses,Bikes and subways- Harold and Helga get left behind after a school field trip to the chocolate factory3.Helga's masquerade- To get Arnold to like her, Helga tries to act like Lila4.Mr.Green runs- Mr.Green decides to run for city council5.Sid the vampire slayer- Sid is convinced that Stinky is a vampire6.Big sis- Helga's older sister Olga gets into the "Big Sis" program and gets paired with Lila7.Bag of money- Arnold,Gerald,and Sid find a bag filled with money8.Principal Simmons- Mr. Simmons becomes the new principal when Wartz decides to resign9.New bully on the block- A new bully challenges Wolfgang10.Phoebe breaks a leg- Helga feels guilty that Phoebe fractures her leg after being hit by a bus while running her errandsDisc-41.Helga's locket- Helga tries every way she can to get her locket of Arnold out of the boarding house before Arnold opens it2.Sid and germs- Sid develops a fear of germs3.Parents day- Arnold finds out from Phil what really happened to his parents4.Suspended- Harold gets suspended and tries everything to get back into school5.Ernie in love- Ernie's new girlfriend wants to quit dating him because of his height6.Summer of love- While at the beach Arnold gets involved with a girl that uses him to try winning a sandcastle competition
